attributes.action: Normalise Bandanas 2020 & Allow Students To Wear Them In School
attributes.additional_details:
Saying bandanas in school a 'distraction' is ridiculous. No one is getting distracted other than the teachers pointing it out. 
If worn as something 'innocent' e.g a hair accessory it should not be frowned upon. 

Wearing bandanas could also be just as effective as the average face mask & should be classed as a facial covering.

This is not a personal issue, but one of many of my friends & students.
From mine & majority if not all students views, they are not a distraction in school(s)
attributes.background:
Create a law stating students can wear bandanas in school or alternatively just in plain colours and/or matching with school uniform.

Normalise the wearing of them in general & stop associating them with gangs especially if worn as just a hair accessory.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Decisions on dress codes for schools are a matter for each individual school to decide.

You might like to sign this petition calling for a ban on school uniforms overall:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550875
